title: System Analyst
summary: As a System Analyst, I was responsible for ensuring the successful operation, development, and alignment of multiple application modules within the Special Economic Zone (SEZ) ecosystem.
responsibilities: 1. Oversaw the development and functionality of the SEZ application ecosystem on the SINSW platform, which plays a critical role in supporting operations across SEZ areas throughout Indonesia.
2. Designed and implemented systems required by the business team, ensuring compliance with government regulations.
3. Acted as the primary liaison between business stakeholders, internal IT teams, and external vendors to maintain alignment and foster effective collaboration.
4. Closely monitored the entire development lifecycle from planning to testing, ensuring that each module met quality and performance standards.
5. Produced detailed and structured system documentation, including legacy designs and new architecture, to support transparency and sustainable scalability.

title: Fullstack Developer
summary: Played a key role in developing API integrations and authentication systems to support inter-agency collaboration and digital services within government-related platforms.
responsibilities: 1. Developed robust RESTful APIs to facilitate secure data exchange between government institutions (KLs) and the company’s systems.
2. Created specific API functions for “lartas” (restricted/prohibited goods) to be integrated within the Smart Engine system, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks.
3. Built both frontend and backend components of the LNSW Single Sign-On (SSO) system, enabling seamless authentication across multiple services.
4. Implemented Geotagging functionality in the SSO registration process to improve data accuracy and user verification.

title: Frontend Developer
summary: As a Frontend Developer in the WebGIS modernization initiative, I played a key role in improving the user interface and performance of Mapid's core platforms—including Geo Mapid, Mapid Forms, and the Admin Dashboard—by implementing a clean, scalable, and modern frontend architecture.
responsibilities: 1. Successfully migrated legacy ReactJS code to the latest version, aligning with platform requirements and performance objectives.

2. Refactored approximately 3,000 lines of legacy code into a modular structure of around 1,000 lines by splitting them into reusable components—significantly improving code readability, maintainability, and development speed.
3. Enhanced core WebGIS functionality by implementing complete GeoJSON CRUD support for point, line, and polygon data types.
4. Built and optimized advanced geospatial features including Isochrone, Heatmap, point dragging, and buffer tools.
5. Created clear and structured documentation for the code I developed, enabling smoother handovers for future developers.

title: IT Support

title: NOC (Network Operating Center)
summary: As a Network Operations Center (NOC) intern, I supported the day-to-day operations of the data center by assisting with physical infrastructure maintenance, access management, and network hardware handling.
responsibilities: 1. Assisted in maintaining data center integrity by managing tenant entry permits and overseeing the intake of new network devices.
